title: Crash drawing polygon using DrawPath with SKGLView on iOS
body:
### Description

The entire app crashes when drawing a polygon with 450 points. 

Message in Debug console:
> The app has been terminated.
> Failed to Stop app:  An error occured on client IDB410102 while executing a reply for topic xvs/idb/4.10.10.2/stop-app
> The app has been terminated.

- The crash occurs now and then. In the sample project (in the git repository pointed to below) you can pinch zoom in and out. If you try that for a while the app crashes. Usually this is within 10 seconds.
- The polygon has no holes. 
- I could not reproduce is the DrawPath Style argument is set to Fill, Stroke or StrokeAndFill seem to be necessary.
- The app zooms in by recalculating the coordinates. Not sure if it crashes with Scale zoom. 
- This is polygon entered by a user. Most polygons don't crash. 

### Code

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pauldendulk/PolygonCrash/master/CrashWhenDrawingPolygon/MyView.cs

### Expected Behavior

No crash

### Actual Behavior

After fast pinch zooming in and out the iOS application crashes.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  1.60.2
- Last known good version:  None, that I know
- IDE: Visual Studio 
- Platform Target Frameworks: iOS when using SKGLView. On Android, WPF and UWP I do use GL views yet.
- Target Devices:
  -   Tested on iPad Air 2 hardware. 

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/963462/42123899-e18aa380-7c59-11e8-8a75-30c64e3625af.png)

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/pauldendulk/PolygonCrash
Reproduce: Place two fingers on the screen and pinch zoom in and out repeatedly. For me it crashes within 10 seconds most of the time.
